wikipedia_page.main: Elphinstone Jackson (9 October 1868 – December 1945) was an English amateur footballer who made one appearance as a full back for England in 1891. He was one of the founders of the Indian Football Association (IFA).

response: * Elphinstone Jackson (1868–1945), England footballer and co-founder of the Indian Football Association

The Indian Football Association, abbreviated as IFA, is the organization that administers association football in the state of West Bengal, India. It is the oldest Football Association in India and was founded in 1893. Among the founders was former English international Elphinstone Jackson.IFFHS - Interesting and curious facts about full internationals and national players (1872-1900)

England awarded six new caps for the Welsh game, including the Everton left wing pairing of Edgar Chadwick and Alf Milward. For three of the débutantes, Leonard Wilkinson (goalkeeper) of Oxford University, Thomas Porteous of Sunderland and Elphinstone Jackson of Oxford University, this was their single England appearance. The final débutante was Albert Smith of Nottingham Forest, who made the first of 3 appearances at right-half.
*Elphinstone Jackson (1868–1945), English footballer and co-founder of Indian Football Association in 1893
